headline: Momentum Commerce Confirms Record Sales for Amazon Prime Day 2025
summary: Momentum Commerce, a modern digital retail consultancy part of PMG, has released its final analysis of Amazon's Prime Day 2025 extended shopping event. The analysis observed more than $750 million in Amazon U.S. transactions across hundreds of brand accounts during the four-day Prime Day 2025 event.

headline: Procter & Rivian downgraded, Starbucks gets a new Sell rating
summary: Evercore ISI downgraded Procter & Gamble (PG) to In Line from Outperform and cut its price target to $170 from $190, citing growing competition from Amazon and slowing growth. Guggenheim cut Rivian (RIVN) to Neutral from Buy and removed its price target on the stock amid reduced confidence in demand and the impact of weaker electric vehicle (EV) incentives. Melius initiated coverage on Starbucks (SBUX) with a Sell rating, warning that the path to a full turnaround may take longer than expected. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Domination here.

Guggenheim cut Rivian (RIVN) to Neutral from Buy and removed its price target on the stock amid reduced confidence in demand and the impact of weaker electric vehicle (EV) incentives. Melius initiated coverage on Starbucks (SBUX) with a Sell rating, warning that the path to a full turnaround may take longer than expected. headline: Bitcoin soars to new all-time high as US lawmakers focus on pro-crypto legislation
summary: Bitcoin continued its rapid climb and hit another all-time high Monday as U.S. lawmakers begin a week focused on passing pro-crypto legislation.  The world’s oldest and most popular cryptocurrency is currently the fifth most valuable asset class in the world at $2.4 trillion, giving it a higher market cap than Amazon.  The enthusiasm for bitcoin comes as the U.S. House is set to take up several pieces of cryptocurrency-related legislation in what’s been dubbed “crypto week” in Congress.

raw.headline: Bitcoin soars to new all-time high as US lawmakers focus on pro-crypto legislation
raw.summary: Bitcoin continued its rapid climb and hit another all-time high Monday as U.S. lawmakers begin a week focused on passing pro-crypto legislation.  The world’s oldest and most popular cryptocurrency is currently the fifth most valuable asset class in the world at $2.4 trillion, giving it a higher market cap than Amazon.  The enthusiasm for bitcoin comes as the U.S. House is set to take up several pieces of cryptocurrency-related legislation in what’s been dubbed “crypto week” in Congress.

headline: Bug Bite Thing Now Offering Tick Testing
summary: Bug Bite Thing, the leader in providing consumers with chemical-free first aid products, including its insect bite relief suction tool and its tick remover tweezer tool, is expanding its offerings to include tick testing. The new service is powered by TickReport, a trusted industry leader, which has provided consumers with accurate tick testing results for over eighteen years and has tested over 300,000 ticks.

headline: Pioneering seaweed harvest takes place in North Sea
summary: Seaweed farmers have made the first-ever harvest at North Sea Farm 1, the world's first commercial-scale seaweed farm located in a field of wind turbines off the coast of Scheveningen in the Netherlands. The farm was created by North Sea Farmers with €2 million funding from Amazon's Right Now Climate Fund.
